citeinfo.title: Methane, nitrogen, oxygen, and carbon dioxide data from Dive 328 on 05/08/2016, Key Biscayne Pockmark

descript.abstract: Methane, nitrogen, oxygen, and carbon dioxide concentrations were collected at two offshore submarine pockmarks, Miami Pockmark and Key Biscayne Pockmark. A series of dives were performed to gather the data using an autonomous underwater vehicle (AUV) with an Underwater Mass Spectrometer (UMS) instrument. The data were collected May 5-8, 2016 using a Bluefin B12 AUV equipped with a UMS and an onboard calibrated Kearfott T-24 Inertial Navigation System (INS) aided by a GPS Wide Area Augmentation System (WAAS), 600 kHz RDI Doppler Velocity Log (DVL) and a Valeport sound velocity meter.
descript.purpose: To conduct a detailed survey and collect methane, nitrogen, oxygen, and carbon dioxide data at the location of two offshore submarine pockmarks, Miami Pockmark and Key Biscayne Pockmark. The data were collected from Dive 328 for the Key Biscayne Pockmark on May 8th, 2016.

idinfo.datacred: SRI International and TerraSond Precision Geospatial Solutions for collecting the data.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted

dataqual.logic: Several tests for permissible values were performed. The test included all samples where the latitude, longitude and depth meet the following requirements: all latitudes within +/- 90 degrees, all longitudes within +/- 180 degrees and all AUV depths within the following range (0 <= depth <= 1000 m). If concentration is <= y intercept then it is set to 0. calibration.
dataqual.complete: All data point records (latitude, longitude, depth and mass concentrations) have been verified as complete

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that are accurate to 10 m. AUV used a calibrated T-24 INS aided by a GPS (WAAS), RDI DVL, SVP and calibrated USBL

vertacc.vertaccr: Depth from a Keller 33X pressure sensor, 100bar unit. 0.05% of FS (0.5m) accuracy

qvertpa.vertacce: Depth sensor manufacturer stated full scale accuracy

procstep.procdesc: Extract concentration data from AUV raw UMS text file
Process concentration using the associated calibration data.

Create a new text file in the format of longitude and latitude in decimal degrees, depth in meters, methane in micromole per kilogram, methane_ppmv in parts per million by volume (ppmv), nitrogen in micromole per kilogram, oxygen in in micromole per kilogram and carbon dioxide in micromole per kilogram.

enttyp.enttypd: Methane, nitrogen, oxygen, and carbon dioxide data at given depths

attr.attrdef: Longitude, decimal degrees, North American Datum of 1983
Latitude, decimal degrees, North American Datum of 1983
Date and time Local mean time date-time string yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss.000
Methane in parts per million by volume (ppmv)
Carbon dioxide in Micromole per kilogram

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302
